Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Landlord \Land"lord`\, n. [See {Land}, and {Lord}.] 1. The lord of a manor, or of land; the owner of land or houses which he leases to a tenant or tenants. [1913 Webster]
2. The master of an inn or of any form of lodging house; as, the landlord collects the rents on the first of the month. [1913 Webster +PJC]
Upon our arrival at the inn, my companion fetched out the jolly landlord. --Addison. [1913 Webster]
landlord n : a landowner who leases to others
